1.text: If I speak in the tongues of men and of angels, but have not love, I am only a ringing gong or a clanging cymbal.

2.text: If I have the gift of prophecy and can fathom all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have absolute faith so as to move mountains, but have not love, I am nothing.

3.text: If I give all I possess to the poor and exult in the surrender of my body, but have not love, I gain nothing.

4.text: Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud.

5.text: It is not rude, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no account of wrongs.

6.text: Love takes no pleasure in evil, but rejoices in the truth.

7.text: It bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.

8.text: Love never fails. But where there are prophecies, they will cease; where there are tongues, they will be restrained; where there is knowledge, it will be dismissed.

9.text: For we know in part and we prophesy in part,

10.text: but when the perfect comes, the partial passes away.

11.text: When I was a child, I talked like a child, I thought like a child, I reasoned like a child. When I became a man, I set aside childish ways.

12.text: Now we see but a dim reflection as in a mirror; then we shall see face to face. Now I know in part; then I shall know fully, even as I am fully known.

13.text: And now these three remain: faith, hope, and love; but the greatest of these is love.
